intro: Cynorkis andringitrana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and prefers well-draining soil. Its foliage is often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps to retain moisture. Cynorkis andringitrana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
